title: 108_s2233
content: The Act may be cited as the "Environmental Research Enhancement Act" and pertains to Environmental Protection Agency research activities. The Environmental Research Enhancement Act establishes the position of Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency. The Deputy Administrator will be appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Senate, considering recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences, the National Academy of Engineering, and the Science Advisory Board. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology oversees the Office of Research and Development, the Office of Environmental Information, the Science Advisory Board, the Science Policy Council, and scientific activities in the regulatory program and regional offices of the Agency. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology is responsible for identifying important scientific issues, developing an Agency-wide strategy for acquiring and disseminating scientific information, and ensuring scientific outreach and communication needs are met. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology oversees scientific outreach, communication, quality assurance, and peer-review activities within the Agency to support regulatory and policy deliberations. They also coordinate with the broader scientific community for relevant knowledge. The Assistant Administrator for Research and Development ensures that scientific information used in Agency decision-making is valid, characterized in terms of uncertainty, and appropriately applied. They are appointed for a 6-year term. The Agency appoints a Senior Research Appointments in Office of Research and Development Laboratories for distinguished environmental researchers. Awards are given to support research in advancing areas related to the Agency's mission and to train promising junior researchers. The Office of Research and Development appoints senior researchers in its laboratories to support research aligned with the Agency's mission and train promising junior researchers. Selection procedures are established for award recipients, with awards lasting 5 years and renewable. Each laboratory must have at least one senior researcher appointed under the program. Appropriations are authorized for carrying out these activities. Other activities of the Office of Research and Development are also outlined. The Office of Research and Development is authorized to appropriate necessary funds for its activities. It aims to give research managers flexibility and accountability, balance core and problem-driven research, and collaborate with other agencies, universities, and industry for research outcomes. The Office of Research and Development aims to improve decision-making processes, establish priorities, allocate funds, and disseminate research products actively. The Administrator of the Agency is tasked with increasing efforts to explain the significance of research projects and assist other entities both within and outside the Agency. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology is directed to expand the science inventory of the Agency by documenting and publishing a detailed inventory of all scientific activities conducted by Agency units. This inventory should include project goals, milestones, schedules, principal investigators, project managers, and allocations of staff and financial resources. The goal is to ensure that these activities are properly managed. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology is tasked with expanding the science inventory of the Agency to ensure proper management of scientific activities. This includes documenting and publishing detailed information on all scientific activities, coordinating activities through the Agency-wide science planning process, and changing the peer-review policy to enhance independence. Additionally, the position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is renamed as the Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency. The position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is renamed as Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency. This change also affects the Executive Schedule Level III.
